channel.description: java.sun.com is the premier source of information about the Java platform.
channel.title: java.sun.com

item.description: Tendu's Java software applications give Major League baseball teams instant insight -- and maybe even a competitive advantage.
item.title: Play Ball!

item.description: Everything you buy, consume, and enjoy--even trees!--may soon be tagged with a unique ID. Learn all about the Java technology that is propelling the Internet ever further into the physical world.
item.title: Toward a Global "Internet of Things"

item.description: Learn about and test you knowledge of Jess, the powerful rule engine and scripting language interpreter implemented in the Java programming language. Review chapter 13, "Adding a Graphical Interface," from the book Jess in Action, then take the quiz!
item.title: Jess in Action Book Excerpt and Quiz

item.description: Create a 3D virtual world through the Java 3D API. Control Drag and Drop between Swing components through the TransferHandler class. Learn how in the current issue of the Core Java Technologies Tech Tips.
item.title: Core Java Tech Tips

item.description: Part three of a series to help developers tune their cross-platform applications to be more Mac-friendly.
item.title: Bringing your Java Application to Mac OS X, Part Three

item.description: Rich Green, Sun's vice president of Sun Developer Tools and Java Software, discusses Project Rave, a new Java tool designed for rapid application development.
item.title: Increasing Developer Productivity with Project Rave: A Conversation with Rich Green

item.description: Use our practical guide to help you tranisition from the MSJVM to Sun's official JRE.
item.title: Java Upgrade Guide: Migrating From the MSJVM to the Sun JRE

item.description: Read about the benefits of upgrading the MSJVM to the official Sun JRE in this article, and visit the Upgrade Program Site where you'll find resources, including a detailed technical guide, a forum, and more.
item.title: Upgrade to the Official Sun Java Platform

item.description: Read and download the latest Java technology resources to develop and enhance your Core, Enterprise, or Wireless applications.
item.title: The September editions of the Java Technology Newsletters are hot off the presses!

item.description: Get some advanced insights into Enterprise JavaBeans Query Language (EJB QL) in the current issue of the Enterprise Java Technologies Tech Tips.
item.title: Enterprise Java Technologies Tech Tips

item.description: Sun chief researcher John Gage reflects on Java technology, Web services, and the future of computing
item.title: Preparing for the Global Community: Part Two of a Conversation with Sun Chief Researcher John Gage

item.description: Blogs are an improvement over browser bookmarking, but the problem of link death is perennial. In this hands-on article, you'll learn about three brand-new, original tools for storing, monitoring, and updating links, using a database and the Velocity template engine.
item.title: Keeping Those Links Up-to-Date

item.description: Everything you wanted to know about the highlights of the Java WSDP 1.2.
item.title: What's New in Java Web Services Developer Pack (Java WSDP) 1.2

item.description: If you've been looking for more information about Project Orion and Project Rave, Sun's upcoming packages for developers, look no further than the SunNetwork Conference, this week in San Francisco. Check out SunNetwork 2003 coverage, including blogs, articles, and news.
item.title: Project Orion and Project Rave: What Developers Want

item.description: The latest editions of the Enterprise and Core Java Technology Newsletters are hot off the presses! Download the latest Java technology early access and product releases and check out the newest resources, events, and announcements.
item.title: Catch the latest Java Technology News!

item.description: Learn the essentials of Java action game development. This article discusses how to design, implement, and tune Java games for small devices such as cell phones.
item.title: Designing and Writing Java Action Games

item.description: Mark your calendars: In a couple of weeks, you'll get a chance to see some of the most exciting new technology for developers -- including Project Orion and Project Rave.
item.title: Come to the SunNetwork Conference and See the Future Clearly

item.description: Get familiar with JAAS, and learn how to make login services independent from authentication technologies.
item.title: Java Authentication and Authorization Service (JAAS) in Java 2, Standard Edition (J2SE) 1.

item.description: They're at it again: JCP planners are at work on a new version of the Java Community Process, to give the spec leads and expert groups even more flexibility -- and make it easier for the Java developer community to participate in the development of JSRs.
item.title: Java Community Process (JCP) 2.6

item.description: Learn the MVC architecture, how to write objects to files, and read the data back into the graphical user interface.
item.title: Dive Log: Part 5
